doc.title: Jefferies
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/2H25 Outlook Downgrade to Hold2H25 Outlook Downgrade to Hold_2025-08-29

passages.text: China (PRC) | Consumer Staples Jonjee Hi- Tech

Jonjee reported 1H25 results with sales/NP down \(18.6\% /24.1\%\) yoy, respectively, which implies \(9.1\% /23.8\%\) sales/NP decline in 2Q. Gross margin improved on lower raw material costs, offset by higher SG&A ratio on channel investments and higher staff costs ratio. It adjusted shipment in 2Q and helped support price and lower distributors' inventory level. The reforms will take time, and industry competition remains intense. Downgrade to Hold with new PT RMB20.

2Q25 sales/ NP declined by \(9.1\% /23.8\%\) to RMB1bn/ 84m. Sales were in line with our est while NP was \(21\%\) lower, due to higher opex ratio with stock incentive expense & higher effective tax rate.

- Condiment sales were down \(3.3\%\) yoy to RMB966m. By product, sales of soy sauce/ other SDC grew by \(6.4\% /2.8\%\) offset by \(13.7\% /48.8\%\) decline in chicken essence/ edible oil. The decline marginally narrowed vs. \(-28.8\%\) in 1Q on a lower base, but still impacted by weak macro and intensified industry competition and its price-supporting measures. By region, sales from East/Central and West/North grew by \(1.1\% /5.6\% /6.8\%\), while South dropped \(12.4\%\) yoy. It increased the number of distributors by 127 to 2,799 in 2Q25, up \(22.5\%\) yoy. The penetration rate in prefecture-level cities/county-level areas in 1H25 reached \(97.9\% /86\%\) . Gross margin improved by 3.2ppts yoy. Meiwexian GPM improved 2.9ppts to \(39.8\%\), thanks to lower raw-material costs and favorable category mix shift. SG&A expense ratio rose 4.5ppts, with a 4ppts increase in selling expense and a 0.4ppt increase in GA's expense ratio. They continue to invest in channel reforms. It recorded \(\sim \mathsf{RMB}11\mathsf{m}\) stock incentive expense in 1H25.

Downgrade to Hold with new PT RMB20. We trim 25- 27E earnings by \(7 - 12\%\) to reflect higherthan- expected operational hiccups, with continued channel reform & SD investments. Our forecasts focus on the core condiment business, and have not included potential land sales. Our new DCF- based PT is RMB20, of which \(\sim \mathsf{RMB}1.3\) is for the land (est. total value \(\sim \mathsf{RMB}1\mathsf{b}\mathsf{n}\) down \(50\%\) considering propfity price decline in Zhongshan & local gov's budget is tight on cash payments), and RMB18.6 is the core business, implying \(23x / 22x\) 2025E/26E PE.

The company's channel reforms to revamp its condiment business are still in progress, and the increased number of distributors does not help with its sales performance. We believe they have been doing adjustments internally and externally, but this may take longer than expected. In addition, condiments industry growth slow- down post Covid has caused more intense competition, while Haitian is gaining more market share.

We downgrade to Hold on less visibility on reform results. Our earnings estimates are \(15 - 24\%\) lower than market estimates, which we believe is because we have less conviction on sales growth recovery in the 25- 27E.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 6 - 11 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

FY (Dec)CHANGE TO JEFeJEF vs CONS20252026REV-4%-4%EPS-13%-10%2025 (RMB)Q1Q2EPS--PREV0.99

- Jonjee has strong branding, but relatively low market share in the condiment sector. We expect the company to improve its channel management to expand distribution and gain market share in the long term.- We forecast 3%/3% sales/net profit CAGR in 2025-27E. Despite intensifying market competition, we are relatively positive considering potential raw material costs mitigation, interest-aligned mgmt team, and stabilized shareholding with improved corporate governance.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Sales/net profit CAGR of \(2\% /6.5\%\) in 2025-27E.  
- Price target of RMB20.

- Better-than-expected macro environment and accelerating premiumization trend.  
- Condiment sales CAGR accelerates to \(7\%\) in 2025-27E, with operating margin expansion.  
- Improved corporate governance  
- Price target of RMB24.5.

- Macroeconomic growth slows down significantly; and consumption downgrades.  
- Condiment sales CAGR decelerates to \(-4\%\) in 2025-27E, with operating margin deterioration.  
- Price target of RMB12.4.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Food safety. Food safety is the basis of food consumption. Maintaining product quality and safety is crucial for Jonjee, as food products are sold directly to consumers. Quality control is needed and potential negative events such as product recalls could harm the brand image. In addition, there are more initiatives on environmental issues like reducing carbon emissions and sustainable packaging. Its subsidiary Meiewexian monitors the environmental protection capability of its suppliers and cooperates with glass bottle manufacturers to reduce energy consumption and carbon emissions.

Company Target(s): 1) Continue to improve product quality control across all processes to ensure healthy and safe condiment products. 2) Zero emission and zero pollution by its industrial business in the long term.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) Do you have any plans to set a medium- to- long timeline for environmental management issues? What are the obstacles? 2) On food safety, what has changed lately along the supply chain to ensure suppliers comply with the company's standards?

- Earnings release  
- Price hikes  
- Updates on new product launches  
- Complete real estate business disposal with reasonable value  
- M&A

We would like to thank Zhaochen Zhang, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

Jonjee Hi- Tech is a major condiment manufacturer in China. It mainly produces and sells soy sauce, oyster sauce, chicken distillate, preserved bean- curd and vinegar under two major brands, namely "Chu Bang" and "Mei Wei Xian". The company was established in 1993 and was listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange in 1995.

We value Jonjee based on a fundamental DCF approach. We factor in \(3.9\%\) risk- free rate, \(5.6\%\) equity premium, \(0.9x\) beta, \(0\%\) target D/DE, and a terminal growth rate of \(3\%\) . We also add RMB3.2bn to enterprise value for the undeveloped land, assuming RMB7,000/sqm, 2.1 plot ratio and \(50\%\) NAV discount.

Downside risks to our price target: higher- than- expected raw material prices; intense market competition; slower- than- expected channel expansion; food safety issue; contingent liabilities of two industrial land (impairment already recognized) and management under investigation (two vice general managers).
Upside risks: Stronger- than- expected revenue growth recovery with successful channel reforms; M&A; successful land sale to local gov.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
